metadata.Title: CVE-2013-3969 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The find prototype in scripting/engine_v8.h in MongoDB 2.4.0 through 2.4.4 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (uninitialized pointer dereference and server crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via an invalid RefDB object.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:2.4.5-1
mongodb-clients - 1:2.4.5-1
mongodb-server - 1:2.4.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.4.5-1').
